Articles.Content:
Woo, science modules! Now when one of my probes crashes I can scream "THE HULL IS BREACHED AND THE SCIENCE IS LEAKING OUT!!!"

"Noooo! Not the science!"

Woo, science modules! Now when one of my probes crashes I can scream "THE HULL IS BREACHED AND THE SCIENCE IS LEAKING OUT!!!"

I hate when my science leaks. 'NEED A SPONGE OVER HERE!'

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?

Measure volts, of course. Those little buggers need to be weighed and measured.
Yay, now I can save my favorite lander that has not enough fuel so I can strand my stupid kerbals on the Mun XD

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?

LOL

Science has its own, strange and sometimes dangerous way... XD

Another great update, and thanks for mentioning the PAX twitch tv in the opening post, because I had missed it.

Yay, just what I was dreaming of : stock subassemblies and science!

I really like the graphical design of the subassemby drop zone, I just hope it won't change too much.

And the thought of advancing in a tech tree through Ã¢â‚¬Â¼scienceÃ¢â‚¬Â¼ and fiery rains of debris on far (and otherwise peaceful) worlds fills me with delight.

Watching the development process of KSP is for me a very instructive and heart warming process, because as a developer, I know hard it is to find the right proportion between giving people what they want and giving people what they need, and the many roadblocks on this road. But with KSP lets me see with my own eyes that, yes, it is possible to breathe life and a vision into your products and still take many user wishes into account.

And please, add me on the list of guests invited to watch the first test run of that flying rocket! XD

Measure volts, of course. Those little buggers need to be weighed and measured.

You need a corked bottle to store them in, first. Voltmeters alone would be useless.

I've just realized - subassemblies.

Folder "landers", folder "first stages", folder "second stages", folder "third stages", folder "escape systems". Oh, this is nice.
Woo! I can now have tons of my very very OP and very very UP landers and boosters all together, so I don't have to figure out for forever how I built it
Will the science module allow the end-user to research how to fix weak attachment nodes, long loading times and 64bit stability?

Sub-assemblies are an game changer for the editor and vehicle design, but radial attachment of multiple parts need some tweaks... if someone tried to attach entire cloned stage to the radial decoupler will know what I'm talking about :-/.

Also I would like to attach sub assembly (or relocate chunk of parts and stick in other place) using whatever node I like, not just one You detached from.

Science and development aspect of the game is very promising though .

Unfortunately 0.22 isn't in the testing phase yet, this is all very early development footage

Ah well, more about the ideas and direction of the features would be nice, maybe some concept sketches or something

Hrm, actually showing concept parts must be tricky, since if the concept doesn't make it into the patch there's always an outcry about where is part X from video Y is, and how much people liked it and the game is ruined forever now etc etc, I don't envy the expectations tightrope the devs and PR people need to walk there.
So what are subassemblies for?

They are for copying parts and using them elsewhere. So, for an example, if you have some launch stage that you want to be able to use with any payload, you can save it and use it later on anything you build.
Looks great! Can't wait to try out 0.22 when its ready. Thanks to Ted for the link to the PAX recording, had to laugh at the keyboard tech glitch......

I have an idea for a new part for the update

Name: Keyboard

Description: It does nothing. It is broken
What's the thing in the middle of the screenshot of the mini-station that looks like an electric razor head?

I have an idea for a new part for the update

Name: Keyboard

Description: It does nothing. It is broken

You must be an Eve player

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?

Measure the effect of negative reinforcement on ESP ability. Kerbal telepathy for the win!

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?
Measure the effect of negative reinforcement on ESP ability. Kerbal telepathy for the win!

Nah, you'll never make it past the Great Barrier at the edge of the galaxy...
Nobody seems to have answered the all-important question: Is there a recorded archive?

What are you going to do with a voltmeter?

Measure volts d'uh

Boris

I wonder if we can do science to the kerbals..... "here just sign on this line for optional employee testing.... I said SIGN! "
0.21 kinda just came out, and i am hyped about 0.22 :DD

It is possible that the resistance of Kerbals varies depending on the amount of atmosphere they are exposed to and/or the level of gravity. Therefore you launch with a voltmeter to determine if the resistance (Ohms) of a Kerbal varies by using a Kerbal in series with a high amperage power source and a voltmeter and measuring the voltage as a Kerbal ascends and is later subject to the vaccum of space.
The link to the archive is on page two of this thread I believe

SuperWeegee4000

Nobody seems to have answered the all-important question: Is there a recorded archive?

You could always check the thread for Convention coverage...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/48252-Squad-Is-at-Cons-this-weekend
All these new features get me so excited

This is just as exciting as .18, .17, or .16!

I think this update will be the most significant since the docking update
